column1: These are some key differences between the Trump and Clinton impeachment proceedings. These are also the reasons why President Trump was impeached for obstructing Congress. #DefendOurDemocracy https://t.co/3prLvx2rt2
I’m proud to fight for the 134000000 people across our country with pre-existing conditions who will lose coverage if Republicans win their anti-health care lawsuit. #ProtectOurCare

No one should face discrimination from an insurer because they have a pre-existing condition but if the GOP’s Texas v. U.S. lawsuit strikes down the Affordable Care Act insurers will be able to do just that. #ProtectOurCare

According to @amprog 54% of our neighbors under 65 here in the 9th Congressional District have pre-existing conditions – that’s the highest percentage in Massachusetts and we are tied with seven other districts for the highest percentage in the nation. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/2BsaSA0qvt

Today I voted to limit the President’s ability to engage in hostilities with Iran unless Congress authorizes them or the use is necessary to defend against an imminent armed attack on the United States or our Armed Forces. https://t.co/R46uoMTv3W

This is not a Trump Organization business negotiation where taunts are a tactic - these tweets risk inciting violence and put civilian lives and the lives of American men and women in uniform around the world in danger.

The President should not be tweeting about fifty-two Iranian targets – a reference to the fifty-two Americans taken hostage in 1979 – because it will not deter a response from Iran. In fact I believe it will act to further incite Iranian leadership. https://t.co/6wMzSL8ZHs
Mitch McConnell is clearly exerting power over seeking truth.  Except that the oath we all took including McConnell requires us to speak truth to power.
Last night Senator Mitch McConnell said that he will coordinate with and take cues from the President’s lawyers for the Senate impeachment trial and that there is no chance of conviction.
Good Luck to @plymouthsouth Panthers and @DuxburyFootball Dragons at Gillette as they contend for Super Bowl titles today!
As JFK so eloquently stated these are the qualities that defined the Massachusetts Bay Colony and the Bay State and they should be the qualities that define Washington as well - from the top down.
Are we men and women of courage? Are we men and women of judgement? Are we men and women of integrity? Are we men and women of dedication?

I began my remarks by reflecting on President Kennedy’s City on a Hill speech given at the State House - and I focused on some specific passages that all of my colleagues should be reflecting upon themselves as we head into a monumental week in Congress:
Great to join my friends at @NECouncil this morning in Boston. https://t.co/vg8tc8UnFA

Today marks #SmallBusinessSaturday - there are 30mil small businesses across the US and thousands here in #MA09. Shopping local supports our economy and I try to do it as often as I can. What's your small-business go-to in Southeast Mass?

We have so much to be thankful for. If you're lucky enough to be spending today with friends & family please take a moment to think of those who are not so fortunate including our troops stationed around the world giving up a holiday to keep us safe at home. Happy Thanksgiving!

I am proud to represent the federally-recognized Mashpee Wampanoag Tribe and the The Wampanoag Tribe of Gay Head (Aquinnah) in Congress and am committed to continuing to fight for their interests. #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth

We must never forget the dark chapters of American history marked by democide relocation and other cruelties toward the women and men who were here long before European settlers took their land. #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth

The people of the Plimoth Colony survived that first winter thanks to the  Wampanoags - and they celebrated that first Thanksgiving in 1621 to give thanks to their alliance. #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth
November is #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth and it's so important for us to recognize that Native American History IS American history.

Now it's China going after our cranberry growers and I am proud to join my colleagues @SenWarren @SenMarkey and @RepJoeKennedy in continuing to fight for our cranberry growers: https://t.co/sQUHyEpqSf

Trump's trade war is bad for local business. When the E.U. proposed retaliatory tariffs against our cranberry growers in 2018 I was able to leverage my relationships with leaders in Europe to stop them.

My prayers are with the families of the lost crew of the F/V Leonardo and the New Bedford fishing community today. Thank you to the heroes at USCG Air Station Cape Cod who recovered the sole survivor and continued the search around the clock with CGC Escanaba and CGC Cobia.
The recent events in the Ukraine clearly show that Secretary Pompeo’s “best” is lacking.

According to new testimony Ambassador Sondland called President Trump to discuss extorting Ukraine for the President’s personal benefit. Last year I questioned Sec. Pompeo on Trump’s cell phone use. He said “every time I see a security issue I try to do my best to fix it.” https://t.co/Tx1rzEhWYy

David Holmes’ reported statement along with Ambassador Sondland’s own prior admissions cast grave concern on the Ambassador’s ongoing ability to effectively represent the United States of America to our greatest democratic allies in Europe.

Stephen Miller must resign or be removed from the White House. The children separated from their parents by his cruel policies are watching and the rest of the world are standing by their side waiting for the President to do the right thing.
There is no place in the world for white supremacy for racism or for xenophobia. Our parents and grandparents - the greatest generation - fought a war on that ideal.

Trump’s Ukrainian dirt-for-arms scandal brought on impeachment investigations but you’re not alone if you don’t fully understand the importance of Ukraine. Here’s what happened and why it’s so important: https://t.co/cN0NXcSckA
I applaud how @EnesKanter is using his voice to bring a spotlight to the grave situation in Turkey and promote democratic ideals there.

Today I met with Celtic @EnesKanter a great basketball player and an incredible human right activist fighting for democracy in Turkey.   Tomorrow my Subcommittee on Europe and Eurasia will be holding a hearing on democratic backsliding among NATO allies including Turkey.

To all of our Veterans to our current military personnel and very importantly to their families: Thank You. Every single U.S. Veteran wrote a check payable with their life and their commitment and dedication inspires us every day. https://t.co/MYyH1qy1tf

.@realDonaldTrump's EU Ambassador has miraculously recalled his role in working with POTUS in withholding military aid to Ukraine in an attempt to coerce Ukraine by conditioning military aid on manufacturing dirt on his political rival. This is the very definition of extortion. https://t.co/Qs7U4fbN0C

I am pleased that the passage of today’s resolution moves us into a new phase of public hearings which will allow for all to witness the Congressional review of the President’s actions and their impact on our national security.
Given my position as a Foreign Affairs Committee Subcommittee Chairman I have participated in hour after hour of preliminary depositions of Administration officials with colleagues from both parties.
Remembering Congressman Elijah Cummings. https://t.co/4zltJ3e1sE

3️⃣  Everyone should take a few minutes and read the transcript of the July 25 call between Trump and the Ukrainian President - I've linked it again here if you haven't read it yet: https://t.co/4acqJrUgcu
2️⃣ Depositions were held privately to avoid coordinated testimony - the plan is to release transcripts to the public.
1️⃣ Questioning is divided equally – 1 hour for Democrats 1 hour for Republicans
I participated in hours of depositions on the impeachment inquiry this past week. Three points:

For a few moments suspend your political inclinations and just read these. After reading them myself I stand by my decision to support an impeachment investigation into these allegations: https://t.co/4acqJrUgcu
We have a Constitutional obligation as a Congress to protect our country. We must move on forward on a formal impeachment inquiry.

The President has acted to coerce a foreign power to undercut our country’s national security and democracy an action declared to be an ‘urgent matter’ by the Inspector General. The Constitution and our rule of law are at stake right now.
Three days later on August 15 Dan Coats resigns as Director of National Intelligence. (5/5)
On August 12 a whistleblower complaint was filed regarding the July 25 phone call. The Intelligence Inspector General determined the complaint to be of “urgent concern.” (4/5)
One week later on July 25 President Trump is alleged by a whistleblower to have made an inappropriate promise to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky while discussing the Biden family. (3/5)
On July 18 President Trump’s decision to withhold $400 million in aid to the Ukraine was made public. (2/5)
It’s a bit of an understatement but there are a lot of questions here that need answers: (1/5)

Proud to walk alongside @GretaThunberg @Jamie_Margolin & @vict_barrett as they head from the Capitol to the Supreme Court to continue their climate change activism. #ClimateCrisis https://t.co/azKo1w7BeP
I hope your testimony today will help to galvanize us to act now before we truly are out of time. #ClimateCrisis    @GretaThunberg  @Jamie_Margolin  @vict_barrett  @BenjiBacker

The Paris Agreement should have been reached decades ago and we should have been well on our way by now towards far more aggressive targets giving communities and industries the time to adapt and giving you a much more hopeful outlook on your future.
I’d like to thank the witnesses for being here and also say that I’m sorry you have to be. #ClimateCrisis
And scientists are gravely concerned that sea level rise in the next hundred years could be even faster than in the last hundred years.

The IPCC Report warns us that without cuts in carbon emissions the world could see an average sea level rise of 62 centimeters over the course of the lifetime of people born today – that is over two feet. #ClimateCrisis
Now the stakes are so much higher and in spite of all our resources and ingenuity the one thing we don’t have is time. #ClimateCrisis

There’s so much we could and should be doing right here in our country. We have the bright minds to engineer the solutions of the future. America has shaped revolutions in industry time and again and it has made our country better off every time.

America knows how to lead in a crisis and it’s high time we pick ourselves up and get back in this fight to bring the rest of the world with us because waiting on other countries to do the right thing is making a bad bet on your futures.  #ClimateCrisis

Change happens through leadership. We wouldn’t be in this situation right now – our witnesses would be safely and happily in school pursuing their dreams and not protesting and pushing their governments to act – if everyone was already doing their part. #ClimateCrisis
Our generation has failed to adequately address our climate crisis. This failure isn’t fatal yet our failure to change will be. #ClimateCrisis
This is a global issue and the biggest polluters are going to need to make big changes to do their part but we need to be honest with ourselves. #ClimateCrisis
There must be leadership in addressing climate change because we and especially your generation can’t afford for things not to change. #ClimateCrisis
... and a real struggle to overcome the political and bureaucratic obstacles that go with making necessary changes to how things currently are.

There have been efforts spanning generations now in my district to diversify our energy supply through offshore wind and solar power and bring new jobs yet there are still major gaps in access for many communities...
And in spite of having some of the best scientists and researchers right there in UMass and Woods Hole it’s an incredible challenge.

Our historic fishing and lobster industries are threatened by increasing ocean acidification and rising ocean temperatures. Our state and local governments are under immense pressure to address not only sea level rise but air and water quality issues.

On Cape Cod we are anticipating sea level rise of 1-2 meters by 2100 and 3-12 meters in the next few hundred years. Erosion and storm damage costs families and businesses more than they can afford and as every storm approaches we hope it will not cost lives as well.
I see it every time I go home. My district in southeastern Massachusetts has one of the longest coastlines in the country and includes island communities. #ClimateCrisis
...this is the reality we are facing right now because of climate change.

We are witnessing the effects of climate change daily. Whether it’s storms forest fires floods and other disasters occurring with increasing intensity and frequency; increased migration due to sea level rise and resource scarcity; or threats to food and water safety...
Our panel today represents the next generation of leaders and so naturally you are speaking for the future. However let us be clear you are also speaking for the present. #ClimateCrisis

Looking forward to Chairing today's hearing with @USRepKCastor as we hear testimony from @GretaThunberg @Jamie_Margolin @vict_barrett & @BenjiBacker on the need for the US to lead on the #ClimateCrisis. Tune in live at 10am: https://t.co/Nh91YYGqP5
Thanks to @TedNesi and @TimWhiteRI for having me on @wpri12 ’s Newsmakers today - tune in on Sunday. https://t.co/jtLbygJlq0
It was beautiful weather in Eastham today for their parade - a wonderful community event to wrap up Windmill Weekend. Special thanks to Don Anderson for the ride! https://t.co/TmtLYWtkdP

It is time for the Equal Rights Amendment to be ratified – I have proudly co-sponsored legislation on this matter in prior Congresses – and it is well past time for Mitch McConnell to allow a Senate vote on The Paycheck Fairness Act which the House passed earlier this year.

We’ve moved at a much faster pace towards equality in the ensuing decades but we are still not where we should be and the speed at which change has come can also serve as a reminder of how quickly it can be chipped away at.
My grandmother who I often share stories about was one month shy of her 40th birthday when she was finally entitled to cast a vote for President.

99 years ago today the 19th Amendment was ratified and women in the United States became eligible to vote in all elections. It’s hard to believe that we are only two or three generations removed from the days before universal suffrage.
Americans deserve as much of a public comprehensive disclosure of facts as the House is able to provide with its oversight responsibility.
Importantly while I support the Judiciary Committee’s impeachment investigation it must not preempt or interfere with the investigations of the five other committees pursuing these serious issues.
The issues include possible criminal fraud money laundering malign foreign influence financial and tax crimes and self-enrichment in violation of the Emoluments Clause among others.
I was disappointed however in the narrow scope of the report and the serious issues it fails to address.
The Mueller report reveals several instances of obstruction of justice certainly enough to move forward with an impeachment investigation. #mapoli https://t.co/Cc1msHABI6
.@RepCummings is a trusted friend and a valued colleague. There is one word for what the President is doing to him: disgusting.
The Congresswomen being attacked are all proud American citizens duly elected to serve by their constituents.  Here in America we don’t tell fellow citizens to “go home.” We welcome them.

This racist attack on my congressional colleagues does not serve to “Make America Great”. America has been made great by those who have come to our country and fought in our wars cured diseases and taught our children. https://t.co/uaVpHkgHyL
With four World Cup titles in twenty-eight years it’s beyond time to recognize the commitment skill and value of our female athletes with equal pay.

Our amazing U.S. Women’s National Soccer Team is being honored today – aptly with a parade through the Canyon of Heroes. These talented athletes will continue to inspire an entire generation of girls and boys.  Special congratulations to USWNST player and Hanson’s own Sam Mewis!

It is important to move forward with legislation to fix issues at the border but it’s also vital to keep in mind that the President could end these horrible conditions today with a simple phone call (or tweet) to the Acting Homeland Security Secretary. https://t.co/dDejhYN1NP

I have also called for no further Homeland Security appropriations to implement family separation and was proud to be part of a strong Democratic coalition to block defense funds being allocated to border wall construction.

H.R. 3239 also requires that detainees are provided with toothbrushes toothpaste soap and feminine hygiene products. It’s stunning to think that we have to legislate the provision of basic needs to refugees fleeing a humanitarian crisis but here we are.

H.R. 3239 also requires that detainees receive drinking water and three meals a day and have access to an adequate number of clean and private facilities to shower change diapers and go to the bathroom.
H.R. 3239 prevents the separation of minors from their parents and requires detainees to receive a medical screening to determine their needs within twelve hours of being detained.
The treatment of detained immigrants dramatically highlights the need to pass H.R. 3239 which mandates basic humanitarian standards for detainees.

Regardless of their immigration status every human being deserves to be treated with respect and dignity and if the Trump administration refuses to uphold that basic American value Congress must act – and we are.

The report on conditions at the border issued yesterday is gut-wrenching. Overcrowded cells families in cages children separated from their parents and denied showers warm meals and clean clothing. Many being detained longer than the 72 hours allowed by law.

On Friday I attended the ribbon cutting of @OuterCapeHealth's new Wellfleet community health center where I was able to share the news that my amendment passed with bipartisan support. #ProtectOurCare #HealthCareWeekend

Since the start of our Congress #ForThePeople @HouseDemocrats have been working to improve health care for all. This week I passed an amendment to provide funding for community health centers across the nation to follow the model put in place by @OuterCapeHealth. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/Bz3BEb3E2q
The fact that none of these officials will answer these questions about #JaredKushner is telling. (11/11)

When I asked then-U.N. Ambassador Nikki Haley what issues #JaredKushner was working on she didn’t have an answer – but she did say that she knew he was very involved with the trip that President Trump made to Riyadh Saudi Arabia. (10/11)
When I asked then-Secretary of State Tillerson what #JaredKushner’s role was when it comes to international relations he told me I’d have to ask Kushner directly. (9/11)

Given all the questions that have been surrounding #JaredKushner since the beginning of this Administration that is an answer we need and Assistant Secretary Cooper should have been transparent today and answered it.  But it’s not surprising that he didn’t. (8/11)
What we don’t know is #JaredKushner's role in this disastrous Saudi weapons deal. (7/11)
And as of reports this week we know that #JaredKushner's opaque business dealings could be affecting his role negotiating highly sensitive deals in the Middle East. (6/11)
We know #JaredKushner has had alone closed-door meetings with the Saudi government. (5/11)
We know #JaredKushner has a personal relationship with members of the Saudi government. (4/11)
We know #JaredKushner is in charge of the President’s Middle East Peace Plan. (3/11)
We know #JaredKushner had issues with his security clearance (2/11)

Yesterday I asked R. Clarke Cooper the Assistant Secretary of the Bureau of Political-Military Affairs what #JaredKushner's role was in the President’s decision to circumvent Congress and agree to an arms deal with Saudi Arabia. He wouldn't answer. (1/11) https://t.co/lckTDpbj89
Our hearts are with the Sox Slugger with the biggest heart and the entire Ortiz family today. Glad to read reports that he is expected to fully recover. https://t.co/pWwf0OLxlI
If the Senate would pass the House’s gun safety bill we could be offering action instead of condolences.
The victims of these tragedies and their families deserve more than heartfelt posts from their elected officials.
There are no words to adequately convey the sadness and anger I continue to feel over these senseless acts of gun violence.
My thoughts and prayers go out to all those affected by the devastating shooting in Virginia Beach tonight.

How could anyone least of all the President of the United States say that an attempt to cover up the name John McCain on one of our ships is "well-meaning?"  It's an affront to all members of our Armed Services and any patriotic American. https://t.co/bAmKYcq1df

Unfortunately LGBTQ Americans still face discrimination in employment housing & other core areas of life in more than half of the United States. I’m proud to be a co-sponsor of the #EqualityAct which has passed the House and is now off to the Senate.

Today marks the 15th Anniversary of marriage equality in Massachusetts - we should be proud of our Commonwealth’s continued leading role in the fight for equal rights for everyone. #mapoli https://t.co/WZB6twWptY

Last week @realdonaldtrump sent a racist tweet to derail our Wampanoag bill.  This week by an overwhelming majority we stood up for the basic rights of not just the Mashpee Wampanoag but all Native Americans.

Trump signed an identical bill last year. So why tweet against a bill recognizing the tribe of the first Thanksgiving? Because of his well-documented alliance with the RI casino lobbyist. A weak attempt to hide corrupt influence in a racist tweet.

Today marks Holocaust Remembrance Day - a day where we remember the six million Jews and millions of others who died simply because of who they were. We must recommit ourselves to never allowing such a global tragedy to occur again by focusing on peace and understanding.
While corporations and the wealthiest are getting a good amount of money back in their pockets the people who have given the most for this country are bearing the burden of the Trump tax cuts.

These are the unintended consequences when a major piece of legislation is drafted behind closed doors without hearings oversight or input from the public.  The Trump tax plan is increasing taxes – by thousands of dollars – on our Gold Star families. https://t.co/FfW3FtqxYo

As a former District Attorney the more I digest of the Mueller Report the harder it is to swallow:   ❌That a document with redactions on one third of its pages is transparent;  ❌That there wasn’t evidence of obstruction of justice.

As a former District Attorney the more I digest of the Mueller Report the harder it is to swallow:   ❌That we can believe a presidential press secretary who admits under oath that she lies to the American public;

As a former District Attorney the more I digest of the Mueller Report the harder it is to swallow:   ❌That we have an AG who represents the public as opposed to one individual;  ❌That the Russian attack on our democracy and the subsequent investigation were hoaxes;
The President’s “Game Over” tweet is wrong.  Defending our values of justice impartiality and rule of law is not a “game.” And our responsibility to protect these values will never be over.
As a former District Attorney I have seen the impacts of domestic violence up close. That’s why I brought the White Ribbon Pledge to Congress for the first time.

We have a fundamental responsibility as a Congress to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act and a moral responsibility to ensure that funding for it never lapses again. That’s why I am a proud co-sponsor of #VAWA19 which passed today. https://t.co/4etSL8bCmK
Providing the public with a summarized or sanitized version of the Mueller report would only compromise confidence in our democracy - the very thing this investigation is trying to protect.

The purpose of the Mueller investigation was to investigate threats and attacks to our democracy. The public should have full access to all the information in the Mueller report absent any material that would compromise intelligence sources or methods.

This week we’re going to introduce legislation to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act and restore net neutrality. We're also going to pass H.R. 1 – the For the People Act to work to restore the American people’s faith in our government. #VAWA #NetNeutrality
Last week we passed two common-sense gun safety bills voted to terminate the President’s emergency declaration and we introduced legislation to restore the Voting Rights Act.
The new Democratic majority was sent to Washington with a mandate to govern – and that’s exactly what we’re doing:

.@JunckerEU declares 25% of EU budget will go to mitigate climate change. Our friends in Europe again take two steps forward while we take two back.  The US should be leading the fight against climate change not focusing energies trying to debunk science. https://t.co/4FbTUMx4b9

Barnstable County Commissioner Ron Beaty’s hateful comments have no place in public discourse and are a disservice to the open and accepting community that so many have worked so hard to create on Cape Cod.

We also had the opportunity to join @SpeakerPelosi for a meeting with EUCOM & NATO Supreme Allied Commander Europe Gen. Scaparrotti. Glad to be here with my Massachusetts friend and colleague @RepLynch. https://t.co/lhGTAKXcl3
Great to meet with Canada's Minister of Foreign Affairs @cafreeland with @SpeakerPelosi and colleagues at @MunSecConf. https://t.co/aR4uCtUl4h

I am attending the Munich Security Conference as part of the congressional delegation led by @SpeakerPelosi and in my role as Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee’s Europe Eurasia Energy and the Environment Subcommittee.

I am proud to be an original cosponsor of the #GreenNewDeal Resolution led in the House by @AOC and in the Senate by @SenMarkey. The time to act on the climate crisis is so long overdue.  Communities like ours have seen signs of what is to come if we don’t address this emergency.
